result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Martinson on Probation for two years.

miscConds.notes:
--no physical discipline of any child including his own children, nieces, nephews and other children 

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no consumption of alcohol at all

--not to take any mood or mind-altering illegal drugs

--supervised visitation with the victim-child for the entire length of the Probation term 

--to complete a parenting class that includes components of what appropriate discipline is and what it is not 

--to only take prescription medications as prescribed 

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Sheriff

timeConds.notes:
-on Count #1 only Mr. Martinson is to serve 3 months in the Jail with Work-release and Huber privileges to commence on 12/26/16 at 5:00pm;  the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this term to the Waukesha County Jail or another County Jail conditional on the term being served under the same conditions which would occur at the Jefferson County Jail. There is not to be any use of electronic monitoring, no passive-restraint type service, no day reporting. The service is to be with standard Huber rules-type reporting 

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[MK] case called at 2:00pm 
Defendant Eric J Martinson in court with Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. The victim's mother is present in court. 
The statement of the victim's mother is read by the victim's maternal grandmother.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.
Mr. Martinson makes a statement. 
The Court makes inquiries of the victim's mother and of Mr. Martinson.  Thereafter the Court informs the Defense of the Court's intention to order supervised visitation as a Probation condition, and the Court recesses to allow the Defense the opportunity to discuss whether Mr. Martinson may choose to reject Probation. 
recess 2:40pm, reconvene 2:45pm. 
Attorney McFadden indicates that Mr. Martinson is not rejecting Probation, however he is requesting reconsideration of the supervised visitation requirement. 
The Court voices that it is steadfast in having this as a condition of the entire Probation term.  
Mr. Martinson indicates that the Court may proceed with ordering Probation. 

The Court marks the Defendant's submission of a packet of PBT results as Defendant's Sentencing Exhibit #1. 
The Court distributes the Court's own Sentencing Exhibit #2, an excerpt of a child developmental milestones listing. 

On both Count #1 and Count #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Martinson on Probation for two years, with conditions:
-on Count #1 only Mr. Martinson is to serve 3 months in the Jail with Work-release and Huber privileges to commence on 12/26/16 at 5:00pm;  the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this term to the Waukesha County Jail or another County Jail conditional on the term being served under the same conditions which would occur at the Jefferson County Jail. There is not to be any use of electronic monitoring, no passive-restraint type service, no day reporting. The service is to be with standard Huber rules-type reporting 
--supervised visitation with the victim-child for the entire length of the Probation term 
--no physical discipline of any child including his own children, nieces, nephews and other children 
--to complete a parenting class that includes components of what appropriate discipline is and what it is not 
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no consumption of alcohol at all
--to only take prescription medications as prescribed 
--not to take any mood or mind-altering illegal drugs 
--to pay any costs and fees

Days credit for time already served:  1 day
Based on the Defendant's assertion that he has already provided a DNA sample, the Court does not require DNA sample provision as part of its orders in this case. 
recess 3:28pm
from Atty. McFadden; letters from Counselor
Sentencing hearing on November 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Criminal Case Settlement Agreement form

[MK] case called at 2:50pm. 
Defendant Eric J Martinson in court with Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; one of the victims is present in the courtroom. 
This case is scheduled for Final Status/Scheduling Conference today and for Jury Trial later this week, however the Defense submits paperwork for the entry of a change in plea.
On Motion of the State, the Court allows the filing of an Amended Information.
Service of the Amended Information admitted.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 & #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Martinson guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On request of the Defense, the Court schedules Sentencing on a later date.
recess 3:16

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on Wednesday 11/30/16 at 2:00pm
AMENDED

[MK] case called at 2:58pm.
Defendant Eric J Martinson in court with Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled today for Motion Hearing on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress, however the Court was informed earlier that the motion would be withdrawn or agreed today.
Attorney McFadden indicates that while he is not withdrawing the Defense Motion, he foresees a resolution of this case. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
The Court indicates that unless a resolution is reached, then the Court will hear the Motion to Suppress on the November 7th date of the Final Status/Scheduling Conference. 
recess 3:01pm. 

NEXT:  the 11/7/16 FSSC and the 11/10-11/11/16 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar

Scheduling Order - The Court Hereby Requires that the Defense file any motion challenging statements on a constitutional basis no later than October 14, 2016. If such motion is filed, the State's response it to be filed by October 21, 2016. Any Defense response to the State's filing is to be filed by October 28, 2016.
cc: Atty Mcfadden, Defendant & DA (via electronic) /tn 09/26/2016
Cover letter for Scheduling Order submitted by the State

[MK] case called at 3:03pm. 
Defendant Eric J Martinson in court with Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mcfadden raises an objection based on the Defense having first received the State's Witness List shortly before noon today.  Attorney McFadden seeks for the Court to impose the sanction of an exclusion of the testimony of the Defendant's wife. 
The Court concludes that there has been a violation of the discovery rules due to the State not providing a witness list in response to the Defendant's demand for discovery . 
The Court determines that precluding the witness would be an inappropriate, unnecessary sanction. 
The Court rules on the Defense objections to the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Defendants Statements.  The Court finds that the statements are otherwise constitutionally admissible, and the Court concludes that the statements attributed to the Defendant through his wife are not otherwise prohibited under the husband-wife privilege. 
ADA Teuber informs the Court and the Defense that the State no longer intends to present evidence of the statement that the Defendant made to social worker Rebecca Gregg.

ADA Teuber informs the Court that there is an issue with "disc 2" of the audio-recordings of the interview of Mr. Martinson with Detective Gary Curtis.  Attorney Mcfadden informed ADA Teuber today that he was not able to play one of the audiorecording-discs. When a replacement disc was provided today to Attorney Mcfadden, he could not open that disc either.   Attorney Mcfadden was able to listen to the recording in the DA's Office shortly before the hearing today. The State will continue its efforts to provide the Defense with a workable disc of the recording.  ADA Teuber confirms that the State intends to present the statements of the Defendant from both discs #1 and #2. 
Attorney Mcfadden requests ajdournment of the Jury Trial scheduled for later this week. 
The Court concludes that in order for the Defense to be in a position that they have had an adequate opportunity to review the audiovisual recordings, adjournment of the Jury Trial is necessary. 
The Court adjourns the Jury Trial. 
Counsel agree that this case should be set for a two-day trial length setting. 

The Court requires the Defense to file any motion challenging statements in disc 2 on a constitutional basis no later than 10/14/16.
If such motion is filed, the State's response is to be filed by 10/21/16 
The Defense response to the State's filing, if any, is to be filed by 10/28/16.

The Court rules on the State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions:  The Court finds that all of Mr. Martinson's prior criminal convictions are status-type offenses and that they have little or no relation to honesty or credibility; they are misdemeanors and somewhat aged. When the Court combines this constellation of factors, the Court denies the State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with prior convictions. 
recess 3:48pm. 


NEXT:  (1) ADA Teuber is to draft the Scheduling Order and submit it by 9/30/16,  (2) Motion Hearing on 11/3/16 at 3:00pm--allow 30 minutes,  (3) FSSC on 11/7/16 at 3:00pm,  (4) Two Day Jury Trial on 11/10-11/11/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 9:48 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Eric J Martinson in court with Attorney John Gatzke. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ confirms victim rights compliance; Court so finds
Atty Gatzke informs the Court that they are still awaiting a pre-trial offer, understand assigned ADA may be on leave. Requests the matter be set for an additional status
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ indicates that there are no ADAs on leave. DA Happ requests the matter be set for formal DA PTC and STC
Court informs parties that It will set matter for trial; Counsel agree matter will need 1 day for trial
DA Happ informs the Court that she is not aware of any witness conflicts, but do have expert which will notify right away
Clerk distributes scheduling order; Court informs parties that no later than 4:00 pm on Wednesday July 6th, the State will not make offer of settlement or will make offer of settlement
Atty Gatzke orally motions to modify bond for work purposes. No objection from State
Court grants bond modification so long as specific dates and places are tendered to the Court. A new bond will then need to be signd. 
Court additionally notes that Mr. Martinson will have to go directly to the training - must also deliniate how will be traveling to the training. If it is by car, plane, etc... and must only be travel for training purposes for work

Case called at 1:21 pm [sf]
Defendant Eric J Martinson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney James Edwin Gatzke. ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
DOB information verified. Updated address provided by the Defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-Not to discipline any child
-No contact with LJM or TEF
-Contact with PBM as approved by Department of Human Services
-No presence at residence of LJM or TEF whether permanent or temporarily occupied
-No discussion of the facts of the case with SJM
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Defendant may return to his residence one time by 1/10/16 with law enforcement to obtain his personal belongings

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:26 pm
